longBusinessSummary: Bank of Maharashtra provides various banking products and services in India. The company operates through Treasury, Corporate/Wholesale Banking, Retail Banking, and Other Banking segments. It accepts savings, current, term, and demand deposits, as well as provides capital gain account schemes. The company also offers housing loans, vehicle and car loans, topup loans, education loans, gold loans, consumer and personal loans, salary gain loans, green financing schemes, roof top solar panel loans, and adhaar loans, as well as loans against properties; working capital, term, project, infrastructure, export, and bill financing services; lines of credit; commercial lease rental services; accounts takeover services; non-fund based services; micro, small, and medium enterprise loans; and agriculture loans and other services. In addition, it provides digital banking and lending services, and government schemes; debit and credit cards; documentary credits and collections, import and export financing, guarantees, travel related forex, non-resident Indian services, remittance schemes, and risk management services; and remittance facilities, as well as hedges exchange risk. Bank of Maharashtra was incorporated in 1935 and is headquartered in Pune, India.
